raw_text:
Dawson joins England injury list
 
 Scrum-half Matt Dawson is an injury doubt for England's Six Nations opener against Wales next weekend.
 
 The World Cup winner missed Wasps' 12-9 loss to Bath on Saturday after injuring his right calf. Wasps coach Warren Gatland said: "He's got a fitness test in the week but he's got a good chance of playing." Gloucester's Andy Hazell and Leicester star Lewis Moody also received knocks during their respective league matches, but should be fit for Wales next week. If Dawson is not fit to face Wales, Robinson will have to choose from Gloucester's Andy Gomarsall or Leicester youngster Harry Ellis.
 
 Jamie Noon is another player on the sidelines after he limped off in the first half against Saracens on Friday with a dead leg. The centre, who is in line for a first Six Nations start against Wales, will have to wait 48 hours before knowing the state of his injury.
llama3.2:1b: Matt Dawson joins England's injury list due to a right calf injury sustained during Wasps' loss to Bath.
llama3.2:3b: Matt Dawson joins England's injury list due to a calf injury suffered during Wasps' loss to Bath. His fitness test next week may determine if he'll play against Wales. Other injured players include Jamie Noon and Andy Hazell, with Lewis Moody expected to be fit for the match.
gemma2:2b: Matt Dawson is injured and may miss England's Six Nations opener against Wales.  Andy Hazell and Lewis Moody are also injured but should be fit for Wales. Jamie Noon has a dead leg and will need 48 hours to know the severity.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Dawson and Gomarsall are the likely replacements for Dawson and Heath Robinson when England face Wales. However, Dawson may not play given his calf injury. Injury list: Jamie Noon limped off in the first half against Saracens with a dead leg and will have to wait 48 hours before knowing his condition.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Matt Dawson injured; Matt Robinson selects between Andy Gomarsall and Harry Ellis as backup. Jamie Noon's injury status uncertain.
qwen2.5:3b: Matt Dawson is an injury doubt for England's Six Nations opener against Wales due to a right calf injury. He missed Wasps' match and was expected to undergo a fitness test in the week. Andy Hazell from Gloucester and Lewis Moody from Leicester are also injured but should be fit for Wales. If Dawson is unavailable, Robinson will have to select either Andy Gomarsall or Harry Ellis from Gloucester. Jamie Noon, with a dead leg, needs 48 hours to recover before his injury status is known.

There are other players on the field too—Jamie Noon limped in the first half. He'll have to wait 48 hours before knowing his status.

Dawson is out for England’s six-nation opener against Wales. Lewis Moody from Leicester may miss next week after a leg injury. Jamie Noon, limping in the first half, will wait 48 hours before knowing his status.
tinyllama:1.1b: England's scrum-half Matt Dawson is set to miss their opening Six Nations game against Wales after suffering an injury during Wasps' match against Bath last weekend. The World Cup winner has been assessed and received a fitness test, but it was revealed that he has injured his right calf. Gloceaster's Andy Goalshall and Leicester's Harry Ellis have also been hit with knocks during their respective league games, but both should be ready for Wales. If Dawson is not fit to face Wales, Robinson will choose from Jamie Noon or Andy Goalshall.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Summary: Matt Dawson is one of England's primary scrum-halters and has been injured during their match against Wasps, causing their 12-9 loss on Saturday. Wasps coach Warren Gatland hopes that Dawson will be fit enough to play in the upcoming Six Nations opener against Wales in February. Injuries have already affected Gloucester's Andy Gomarsall and Leicester's Lewis Moody, who are also expected to face Wales. The only certainty is Jamie Noon's participation in the match, which could wait until 48 hours beforehand.
phi:2.7b: Matt Dawson is uncertain if he can play for England's Six Nations opener due to an injured right calf. Other players like Andy Hazell and Lewis Moody also got injuries but should be fit to face Wales next week. If Dawson is not fit, Robinson will have to choose between two other players. Jamie Noon, another player, may need to wait a day before knowing the extent of his injury.
orca-mini:3b: Matt Dawson joins England's injury list, expected to recover for Wales next week.
hermes3:3b: Matt Dawson, Scrum-half for England, potentially injured for Six Nations opener against Wales due to right calf injury; alternative players Andy Gomarsall or Harry Ellis if unfit.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Scrum-half Matt Dawson is doubtful for England's Six Nations opener against Wales due to a right calf injury. Wasps coach Warren Gatland mentioned that he might play if he passes a fitness test, while Gloucester's Andy Hazell and Leicester's Lewis Moody also sustained injuries but should be fit for Wales' match. If Dawson cannot play, Robinson will have to choose between Gloucester's Andy Gomarsall or Leicester's Harry Ellis. Additionally, Jamie Noon is another player sidelined with a dead leg, awaiting further assessment in 48 hours.

Wasps coach Warren Gatland remains hopeful about his recovery. Andy Hazell and Lewis Moody also picked up knocks but are expected to be fit. If Dawson is unavailable, Andy Gomarsall or Harry Ellis may replace him. Jamie Noon is also sidelined with a dead leg and will need 48 hours to assess his condition.
stablelm2:1.6b: Scrum-heel Matt Dawson doubtful for England's Six Nations opener vs. Wales due to calf injury. Jamie Noon also injured with a dead leg, potentially leading to choices from Andy Gomarsall or Harry Ellis if Dawson cannot play.
granite3.1-dense:2b: England's scrum-half Matt Dawson is an uncertain choice for their Six Nations opener against Wales next weekend due to a right calf injury sustained during Wasps' match. While Washes coach Warren Gatland believes he has a good chance of playing, a fitness test will determine his availability. Dawson's absence might force the team to select either Andy Gomarsall from Gloucester or Harry Ellis from Leicester as his replacement. Meanwhile, other players like Jamie Noon and a center who played against Saracens are also sidelined with injuries.
reference: Gloucester's Andy Hazell and Leicester star Lewis Moody also received knocks during their respective league matches, but should be fit for Wales next week.Scrum-half Matt Dawson is an injury doubt for England's Six Nations opener against Wales next weekend.The centre, who is in line for a first Six Nations start against Wales, will have to wait 48 hours before knowing the state of his injury.
